description: The function 'generate_double_line_plot' creates a double line plot, which is a type of graph that displays two sets of data points on the same x-axis. The function is used for educational purposes, particularly in teaching students about data visualization and comparison of two datasets.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Double Line Plot
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function 'generate_double_line_plot' can draw a double line plot, a type of graph that shows two sets of data points on the same x-axis. The input to this function is a 'DoubleLinePlot' object, which contains information about the x-axis label, the range of the x-axis, and two datasets. Each dataset contains a title and a list of data points, with each data point having a value and a frequency. The function has constraints on the frequency of data points, which should be between 0 and 8. This function is useful in teaching students about data visualization, comparison of datasets, and understanding frequency distributions.

details: x_axis_label: The label for the x-axis of the double line plot.
range: The range of the x-axis of the double line plot, which includes a minimum and maximum value.
datasets: Two datasets for the double line plot, each containing a title and a list of data points.
data_points: Each data point in a dataset has a value and a frequency.
The frequency of data points should be between 0 and 8.
The datasets are validated after they are created, with the data points sorted by value.
The function draws a double line plot with two sets of data points on the same x-axis.
The x-axis has a label and a range, and each data point is represented by a marker.
The position and frequency of the markers are determined by the value and frequency of the data points, respectively.
